revised_title: Stress and Electrification Effects in Resin and Resin-Oil Compounds
tldr: The author investigates the stress and other effects produced in resin and a viscous compound of resin and oil by electrification. The experiments reveal that a smooth resin surface can retain an electric charge and that the character of the stress figures depends on factors such as the form and size of the terminals, the distance from the dielectric surface, and the potential and character of the spark at the spark-gap.
